name: flabbily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
weakly and without force: He fell flabbily to his knees, unable to walk any further. They had come up with some good policies, but they had been too flabbily implemented.
badly organized with a lot of waste: It was a very flabbily written piece of work that needed a good edit. The flabbily directed and poorly acted play left the audience and critics disappointed.
More examplesFewer examplesShe tried to persuade the board to revise its plans, but her points were too flabbily made.The ideas in his speech needed to be less flabbily organized.It was no more than a flabbily organized group of individuals and so could make little impact.
